questions.question: What language adds interactivity to web pages?
questions.explanation: JavaScript is programming language enabling interactivity on web pages. Executes in browser (client-side). Manipulates DOM (HTML elements), handles events (clicks, input). Popular frameworks: React, Vue, Angular. Essential for modern web. Server-side (Node.js) also possible.

questions.question: What holds data value?
questions.explanation: Variable stores data value. Declaration: var, let, const. var: function-scoped (avoid). let: block-scoped, reassignable. const: block-scoped, immutable. Naming: camelCase convention. Types: string, number, boolean, object, array. Assignment: variableName = value.

questions.question: What are text data type?
questions.explanation: String represents text. Syntax: 'single', "double", `backticks` (template literals). Template literals: interpolation ${variable}. Methods: length, substring(), toUpperCase(), toLowerCase(). Common: user input, messages. Immutable: operations return new string.

questions.question: What are numeric data type?
questions.explanation: Number represents integers, decimals. Operators: +, -, *, /, %. Special values: NaN (not a number), Infinity. Methods: parseInt(), parseFloat(), toFixed(). Math object: Math.round(), Math.floor(), Math.max(). Precision: 64-bit floating point.

questions.question: What are boolean data type?
questions.explanation: Boolean represents true or false. Operators: && (AND), || (OR), ! (NOT). Comparison: ==, ===, !=, !==, <, >, <=, >=. Truthy/Falsy: non-zero/non-empty = true, null/undefined/0/'' = false. Conditionals: if/else use booleans. Logic foundation.

questions.question: What displays output?
questions.explanation: console.log() displays output in browser console. Debugging: inspect variables, execution flow. Syntax: console.log('message', variable). Other methods: console.error(), console.warn(), console.table(). Development tool: not visible to users. Essential for debugging.

questions.question: What executes code conditionally?
questions.explanation: if/else executes code based on condition. Syntax: if (condition) {...} else {...}. Condition: boolean expression. Else if: multiple conditions. Ternary: condition ? true : false. Controls program flow based on decisions. Essential control structure.

questions.question: What repeats code block?
questions.explanation: Loop repeats code block. Types: for (known iterations), while (condition-based), for...of (iterate collection). Syntax: for (let i = 0; i < 10; i++) {...}. Break: exit loop. Continue: skip iteration. Essential: process arrays, generate sequences.

questions.question: What organizes related data?
questions.explanation: Object stores related data as key-value pairs. Syntax: {key: value}. Access: object.key or object['key']. Properties: attributes. Methods: functions within object. Used constantly: DOM elements, API responses, modeling real-world entities.

questions.question: What organizes ordered data?
questions.explanation: Array stores ordered values. Syntax: [value1, value2, ...]. Access: array[index] (0-based). Methods: push(), pop(), length. Iteration: for loop, forEach(), map(). Common: store lists of items, process collections. Mutable: modify after creation.
